documents.document: "Perseverance is failing nineteen times and succeeding the twentieth." - Julie Andrews
"Never mistake motion for action." - Ernest Hemingway
"He that can have patience can have what he will." - Benjamin Franklin
"You cannot change your destination overnight, but you can change your direction overnight." - Jim Rohn
"Failure is the opportunity to begin again, more intelligently." - Henry Ford
"All great changes are preceded by chaos." - Deepak Chopra
"Do we need more time? Or do we need to be more disciplined with the time we have?" - Kerry Johnson
"Destiny is not a matter of chance; but a matter of choice." - William Jennings
"Let me tell you the secret that has led me to my goal. My strength lies solely in my tenacity." - Louis Pasteur
"Happiness is a choice that requires effort at times" - Aeschylus
"Efforts and courage are not enough without purpose and direction." - John F. Kennedy
"The value of achievement lies in the achieving." - Albert Einstein
"It isn't what you do, but how you do it." - John Wooden
"Look deep into nature, and you will understand everything better." - Albert Einstein
"One is always a long way from solving a problem until one actually has the answer." - Stephen Hawking
"I can accept failure, everyone fails at something. But I can't accept not trying." - Michael Jordan
"It is good to have an end to journey towards; but it is the journey that matters in the end." - Ursula Le Guin
"It is not easy to find happiness in ourselves, and it is not possible to find it elsewhere." - Agnes Repplier
"Things which matter most must never be at the mercy of things which matter least." - Goethe
"Happiness is when what you think, what you say, and what you do are in harmony." - Mahatma Gandhi
"A journey of a thousand miles must begin with a single step." - Lao-Tsu
"Excellence is not a skill. It is an attitude." - Ralph Marston
"Life is the art of drawing without an eraser." - John W. Gardner
"The key to any game is to use your strengths and hide your weaknesses." - Paul Westphal
"There are only two tragedies in life: one is not getting what one wants, and the other is getting it." - Oscar Wilde
"Happiness is when what you think, what you say, and what you do are in harmony." - Mahatma Gandhi
"Management by objective works - if you know the objectives. Ninety percent of the time you don't." - Peter Drucker
"The artist is nothing without the gift, but the gift is nothing without work." - Emile Zola
"Don't judge each day by the harvest you reap, but by the seeds you plant." - Robert Louis Stevenson
"To climb steep hills requires slow pace at first." - William Shakespeare
"Tough times never last, but tough people do." - Dr. Robert Schuller
"You will never find time for anything. If you want the time, you must make it." - Charles Buxton
"The greatest mistake you can make in life is to be continually fearing you will make one." - Elbert Hubbard
"Hold yourself responsible for a higher standard than anybody else expect of you." - Henry Ward Beecher
"While we are postponing, life speeds by." - Seneca"
"Man can believe the impossible, but can never believe the improbable." - Oscar Wilde
"This world is but a canvas to our imagination." - Henry David Thoreau
"A person who never made a mistake never tried anything new." - Albert Einstein
"The results you achieve will be in direct proportion to the effort you apply." - Denis Waitley
"We will either find a way, or make one." - Hannibal
"It is a rough road that leads to the heights of greatness. - Seneca
"I've failed over and over and over again in my life and that is why I succeed." - Michael Jordan
"Freedom is nothing but a chance to be better." - Albert Camus
"All our dreams can come true, if we have the courage to pursue them." - Walt Disney
We generally change ourselves for one of two reasons: inspiration or desperation." - Jim Rohn
"Great spirits have always encountered violent opposition from mediocre minds." - Albert Einstein
"Formula for success: under promise and over deliver." - Tom Peters
"The true definition of madness is repeating the same action, over and over, hoping for a different result." - Albert Einstein
"The purpose of our lives is to be happy." - Dalai Lama
"A business that makes nothing but money is a poor business." - Henry Ford
"Enthusiasm finds the opportunities, and energy makes the most of them." - Henry Hoskins
"Knowledge speaks, but wisdom listens." - Jimi Hendrix
"Try not to become a man of success, but rather try to become a man of value." - Albert Einstein
"A true critic ought to dwell rather upon excellencies than imperfections." - Joseph Addison
"The time to relax is when you don't have time for it." - Jim Goodwin
"A goal without a plan is just a wish." - Antoine de Saint Exupery
"Heroes are made in the hour of defeat. Success is, therefore, well described as a series of glorious defeats." - Gandhi
"Your philosophy determines whether you will go for the disciplines or continue the errors." - Jim Rohn
"Wisdom begins in wonder." - Socrates
"Sometimes the easiest way is the hard way." - John Finn
"Be yourself; everyone else is already taken." - Oscar Wilde
"In everything we do, our own thoughts can help us succeed, or they can help us fail. Maintain a positive attitude." - Catherine Pulsifer
"I cannot teach anybody anything, I can only make them think." - Socrates
"Life has no limitations, except the ones you make." - Les Brown
"Obstacles are those frightful things you see when you take your eyes off the goal." - Henry Ford
"The only people who never fail are those who never try." - Ilka Chase
"Excellence is the unlimited ability to improve the quality of what you have to offer." - Rick Pitino
"You cannot tailor make your situation in life, but you can tailor make your attitudes to fit those situations." - Zig Ziglar
"Until you make peace with who you are, you'll never be content with what you have." - Doris Mortman
"If you do what you've always done, you'll get what you've always gotten." -Tony Robbins
"I'd rather be a failure at something I love than a success at something I hate." - George F. Burns
"Kindness in words creates confidence. Kindness in thinking creates profoundness. Kindness in giving creates love." - Lao Tzu
"Champions are propelled by desire, not compelled by fear." - Denis Waitley
"The hardest thing to see is what is in front of your eyes." - Johann Wolfgang von Goethe
"The best way to cheer yourself up is to try to cheer somebody else up." - Mark Twain
"It's kind of fun to do the impossible." - Walt Disney
"It's not what you are that holds you back, it's what you think you are not." - Denis Waitley
"Where the willingness is great, the difficulties cannot be great." - Machiavelli
"Success is the maximum utilisation of the ability that you have." - Zig Ziglar
"A short saying often contains much wisdom." - Sophocles
"I believe that every person is born with talent." - Maya Angelou
"Everything should be made as simple as possible, but not simpler." - Albert Einstein
"Nothing will ever be attempted if all possible objections must first be overcome." - Samuel Johnson
"I can resist anything but temptation." - Oscar Wilde
"It doesn't matter if I don't succeed in something, what matters is that I learn from my mistakes." - Linda Evans
"It's not that I'm so smart , it's just that I stay with problems longer ." - Albert Einstein
"The best way to have a good idea is to have lots of ideas." - Linus Pauling
"Never, never, never give up." - Winston Churchill
"Ability will never catch up with the demand for it." - Confucius
"Forgive yourself for your faults and your mistakes and move on." - Les Brown
"If you do not change direction, you may end up where you are heading." - Lao Tzu
"Little by little, one travels far." - J. R. R. Tolkien
"Genius without education is like silver in the mine." - Benjamin Franklin
"Take time for all things: great haste makes great waste." - Benjamin Franklin
"Love without action is meaningless and action without love is irrelevant." - Deepak Chopra
"While we stop to think, we often miss our opportunity." - Publilius Syrus
"Some people grumble because roses have thorns; I am thankful that the thorns have roses." - Alphonse Karr
"You can adopt the attitude there is nothing you can do, or you can see the challenge as your call to action." - Catherine Pulsifer
"I love Mickey Mouse more than any woman I have ever known." - Walt Disney
"When I let go of what I am, I become what I might be." - Lao Tsu
